MUST revert if `_to` is the zero address. MUST revert if length of `_ids` is not the same as length of `_values`. MUST revert if any of the balance(s) of the holder(s) for token(s) in `_ids` is lower than the respective amount(s) in `_values` sent to the recipient. MUST revert on any other error. MUST emit `TransferSingle` or `TransferBatch` event(s) such that all the balance changes are reflected (see \"Safe Transfer Rules\" section of the standard). Balance changes and events MUST follow the ordering of the arrays (_ids[0]/_values[0] before _ids[1]/_values[1], etc). After the above conditions for the transfer(s) in the batch are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call the relevant `ERC1155TokenReceiver` hook(s) on `_to` and act appropriately (see \"Safe Transfer Rules\" section of the standard).","params":{"_data":"Additional data with no specified format, MUST be sent unaltered in call to the `ERC1155TokenReceiver` hook(s) on `_to`","_from":"Source address","_ids":"IDs of each token type (order and length must match _values array)","_to":"Target address","_values":"Transfer amounts per token type (order and length must match _ids array)"}},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Caller must be approved to manage the tokens being transferred out of the `_from` account (see \"Approval\" section of the standard). MUST revert if `_to` is the zero address. MUST revert if balance of holder for token `_id` is lower than the `_value` sent. MUST revert on any other error. MUST emit the `TransferSingle` event to reflect the balance change (see \"Safe Transfer Rules\" section of the standard). After the above conditions are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call `onERC1155Received` on `_to` and act appropriately (see \"Safe Transfer Rules\" section of the standard).","params":{"_data":"Additional data with no specified format, MUST be sent unaltered in call to `onERC1155Received` on `_to`","_from":"Source address","_id":"ID of the token type","_to":"Target address","_value":"Transfer amount"}},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"details":"MUST emit the ApprovalForAll event on success.","params":{"_approved":"True if the operator is approved, false to revoke approval","_operator":"Address to add to the set of authorized operators"}},"setIActorAddress(address)":{"details":"Only Owner can set the ActorFactory contract, it helps when the Actor Factory migrates","params":{"_actorFactoryAddress":"address of the IActor"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."}}},"userdoc":{"methods":{"approveTokenCreation(uint256)":{"notice":"Approves a previously created token to be used. The only user allowed to approve the token creation is the original coffe owner."},"balanceOf(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Get the balance of an account's Tokens."},"balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Get the balance of multiple account/token pairs"},"burn(uint256,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Recieves an amount of tokens of a given type to be burned. A token that is burned becomes unusable and it means the sender will receive coffee in return."},"create(string,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Creates the new token for the address in _recipient to approve it. The token cannot be used it until it's approved."},"getTokensWithBalance(address)":{"notice":"Returns an array containing all the ids of the tokens this address has a positive balance. This is intended to be used to show al the tokens available for this address at once without maintaining the ids stored somewhere else."},"isApprovedForAll(address,address)":{"notice":"Queries the approval status of an operator for a given owner."},"safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,uint256[],uint256[],bytes)":{"notice":"Transfers `_values` amount(s) of `_ids` from the `_from` address to the `_to` address specified (with safety call)."},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Transfers `_value` amount of an `_id` from the `_from` address to the `_to` address specified (with safety call)."},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"notice":"Enable or disable approval for a third party (\"operator\") to manage all of the caller's tokens."},"setIActorAddress(address)":{"notice":"Sets the address of the typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address,address,uint256[] memory,uint256[] memory,bytes memory) external returns (bytes4)
literal_string "contract returned an unknown value from onERC1155BatchReceived"

params._id: The id of the token to be approved

params._owner: The address of the token holder

balanceOf(address,uint256).return: The _owner's balance of the Token type requested

params._owners: The addresses of the token holders

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).return: The _owner's balance of the Token types requested (i.e. balance for each (owner, id) pair)

burn(uint256,uint256,address).details: The balance of the _from address must be equal or greater than the amount specified and the _id must belong to a previously created token (approved creation).

params._amount: The amount of tokens to be burned.
params._from: The address from which the tokens will be burned
params._id: The id of the token to be burned.

params._initialSupply: The amount of tokens to mint for this new type
params._uri: The URI pointing to the JSON (it must conforms to the "ERC-1155 Metadata URI JSON Schema".)

create(string,address,uint256).return: The id of the newly created token

getTokensWithBalance(address).details: Looking for better ways to do this, it can change in the future.

params._address: The address to get the tokens

getTokensWithBalance(address).return: An array containing the ids of the tokens

isApprovedForAll(address,address).return: True if the operator is approved, false if not

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,ui.details: Caller must be approved to manage the tokens being transferred out of the `_from` account (see "Approval" section of the standard). MUST revert if `_to` is the zero address. MUST revert if length of `_ids` is not the same as length of `_values`. MUST revert if any of the balance(s) of the holder(s) for token(s) in `_ids` is lower than the respective amount(s) in `_values` sent to the recipient. MUST revert on any other error. MUST emit `TransferSingle` or `TransferBatch` event(s) such that all the balance changes are reflected (see "Safe Transfer Rules" section of the standard). Balance changes and events MUST follow the ordering of the arrays (_ids[0]/_values[0] before _ids[1]/_values[1], etc). After the above conditions for the transfer(s) in the batch are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call the relevant `ERC1155TokenReceiver` hook(s) on `_to` and act appropriately (see "Safe Transfer Rules" section of the standard).

params._data: Additional data with no specified format, MUST be sent unaltered in call to the `ERC1155TokenReceiver` hook(s) on `_to`
params._ids: IDs of each token type (order and length must match _values array)
params._values: Transfer amounts per token type (order and length must match _ids array)

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Caller must be approved to manage the tokens being transferred out of the `_from` account (see "Approval" section of the standard). MUST revert if `_to` is the zero address. MUST revert if balance of holder for token `_id` is lower than the `_value` sent. MUST revert on any other error. MUST emit the `TransferSingle` event to reflect the balance change (see "Safe Transfer Rules" section of the standard). After the above conditions are met, this function MUST check if `_to` is a smart contract (e.g. code size > 0). If so, it MUST call `onERC1155Received` on `_to` and act appropriately (see "Safe Transfer Rules" section of the standard).

params._data: Additional data with no specified format, MUST be sent unaltered in call to `onERC1155Received` on `_to`

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: MUST emit the ApprovalForAll event on success.

params._approved: True if the operator is approved, false to revoke approval
params._operator: Address to add to the set of authorized operators

setIActorAddress(address).details: Only Owner can set the ActorFactory contract, it helps when the Actor Factory migrates

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

approveTokenCreation(uint256).notice: Approves a previously created token to be used. The only user allowed to approve the token creation is the original coffe owner.

balanceOf(address,uint256).notice: Get the balance of an account's Tokens.

balanceOfBatch(address[],uint256[]).notice: Get the balance of multiple account/token pairs

burn(uint256,uint256,address).notice: Recieves an amount of tokens of a given type to be burned. A token that is burned becomes unusable and it means the sender will receive coffee in return.

create(string,address,uint256).notice: Creates the new token for the address in _recipient to approve it. The token cannot be used it until it's approved.

getTokensWithBalance(address).notice: Returns an array containing all the ids of the tokens this address has a positive balance. This is intended to be used to show al the tokens available for this address at once without maintaining the ids stored somewhere else.

isApprovedForAll(address,address).notice: Queries the approval status of an operator for a given owner.

safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,ui.notice: Transfers `_values` amount(s) of `_ids` from the `_from` address to the `_to` address specified (with safety call).

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.notice: Transfers `_value` amount of an `_id` from the `_from` address to the `_to` address specified (with safety call).

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).notice: Enable or disable approval for a third party ("operator") to manage all of the caller's tokens.

setIActorAddress(address).notice: Sets the address of the ActorFactory
